content.description: A few hard moves off the deck lead to a bunch more hard moves higher up. Sustained.
content.protection:
Bolts to chains. The top anchors look a little suspect...

It may be worth it to lower off the shuts for Private Little War
content.location: To the left of Private Little War. This is the furthest left route on the wall that does not climb the arete.

content.description:
Another hard climb. Haven't done any of the movement on this route, but it looks good.

(adding this for completeness only)
content.location: Start on the obvious chalked holds to the right of Private Little War, go straight up to the summit.

climbs.name: That Which Survives
climbs.fa: Steve Edwards, Dave Talsky, Mark Robinson

content.description: The left arete. Climb both sides of the arete past four bolts. Looks scarier than it is. Some holds have broken over the years, making it less aesthetic and, maybe, less safe. Retrobolting is fine by me if anyone wants to fix this line up.

climbs.name: Private Little War
climbs.fa: Equipped by Steve Edwards, it may still be undone...

content.description:
An interesting start off a good right-hand sidepull and an (optional) undercling to a good left-hand slot gets you going. Another move or two gets you to a ledge from which you can get the second bolt. Prepare yourself and cast off...

Great movement. Awesome position. You should do it.
content.protection:
Bolts with open shuts at the top.

The upper headwall is very bolted. Perhaps 4-5 feet between bolts for the crux.

A stick clip might be nice for the start, but is not necessary.
content.location: Start smack dab in the middle of the wall, between Stealing Fire (to the left) and Monsters in the Maze (to the right).

content.description:
I've heard nothing but praise for this route, but I've yet to try it.

A link up of the first part of Quartz Crystal and the second part of Dagger of the Mind, it is the best of both routes.
content.location: Start on Quartz Crystal, after the third bolt (second opinion please?) traverse right into Dagger of the Mind using good, blocky holds.

content.description:
Yet another hard climb. Haven't done anything on this route either.

(adding for completeness only)
content.protection:
Bolts

A little more PG than its neighbors, there are half as many bolts in almost as much space as Private Little War, but it still looks safe.
content.location: The furthest right bolt-line on the West Face.
